page.title: 14BROCKWEIR SCHOOL
page.content: Brockweir Primary School was opened in 1896 and is funded today by Glouce- stershire Education Authority.Its pre- sent Headmistress is Mrs.Hopwood who is working on the Domesday Project with her pupils,on the area south of the school. There are forty-five children in the school:-twenty infants and twenty-five juniors.All but two of the children live in Brockweir or Hewelsfield. The number of children attending the school has remained fairly steady. There are two classes of mixed ages and abilities.The children go on to Wyedean Comprehensive in Sedbury when they are eleven.The school has a happy family atmosphere with 75% of the pupils staying for school lunch (unus- ual in this age of packed lunches).A new Airline Canteen Service has proved very popular with the children.
